description: The purpose of the module is to discuss the themes of life, love, and death in classical Chinese literature from several perspectives. It looks at the different ways the topics concerning life, love and death are handled in various genres and historical periods. The content of the course will include a variety of genres, including lyrical and narrative poetry, short stories, prose and novels, spanning from Zhou to Qing dynasty. This course is designed to deepen studentsâ€™ understanding of the most important themes of classical Chinese literature.
title: Life, Love, and Death in Classical Chinese Literature
